text: The RealReal is not always honest with descriptions of their inventory so you have to be very careful. All of my recent purchases labeled “with tags” in the description did not arrive with any original tags (other than The RealReal’s). A handbag that was labeled as being in “pristine” condition arrived with scuff marks all over the patent leather. Sad to say that the quality of this business has gone way down in recent years and I will be taking my business elsewhere.

author: customer CCS
text: So far, my first time using the real real hasn’t been Positive.  I received my sweater & it was damaged.  Someone had clipped off the care instructions tags & in doing so, they cut a hood in the sweater.  I reached out to TTR saying other than the hole I liked the sweater & I cld have it hemmed but asked for a partial refund.  They just responded to me & said the sweater I ordered in Final Sale, no returns & would I like a $10 credit for a next purchase.  Firstly I didn’t ask for a refund, or a credit, I asked for a partial refund for this particular transaction.  And just today I found another hole (also like the first not disclosed in the description).  If TRR doesn’t settle this transaction properly, I don’t want to be a return customer.  I never even used my $25 off $50 purchase welcome offer before it expired.  I’m going to share all this with them & see how they handle it.  But buyers beware…personally I know these are used clothes, but if damage is not disclosed there should be better consumer protection.  It should be up to the buyer to make the educated/informed to buy a damaged good.  Not get a damaged good & then be asked to come back to spend more money on another item as a solution to remedy the first wrong.
title: So far, no so good…
